name: ext_R5_Attachment_size
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.Attachment.size for use in FHIR R4B
description: This cross-version extension represents Attachment.size from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Attachment|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4B.

element.short: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)
element.definition: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).
element.comment: `Attachment.size` maps to R4B `Attachment.size`. Has no type mapping So is mapped as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children unless an empty Parameters resource
constraint.expression: hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()) or $this is Parameters

constraint.human: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
